main_definition: Respondents are individuals or groups who provide answers, opinions, or feedback in response to surveys, questionnaires, interviews, or studies.

meanings_and_examples.example: In the customer satisfaction survey, 500 respondents shared their opinions on various products.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Individuals providing feedback or answers to questions
meanings_and_examples.example: The research team collected responses from participants after conducting an online questionnaire about environmental awareness.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Persons who answer a poll or survey in qualitative social science research
meanings_and_examples.example: In the sociological study, 100 respondents were interviewed to understand community dynamics and perceptions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Those selected for participating in an experiment or observation as subjects
meanings_and_examples.example: The clinical trial enrolled 200 respondents to test the effectiveness of a new medication on patients with hypertension.
